paragraphs.text:
Robotics is the branch of technology that deals with the design, construction, operation, structural disposition, manufacture and application of robots.[1] Robotics is related to the sciences of electronics,  engineering, mechanics, and software.[2]  The word "robot" was introduced to the public by Czech writer Karel ÄŒapek in his play R.U.R. (Rossum's Universal Robots), published in 1920. The term "robotics" was coined by Isaac Asimov in his 1941 science fiction short-story "Liar!"[3]
